name: Paler Sneaker of Doom: Rogue 19 / Bard 5 / Pale Master 16
author: KailPendragon

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
The necromantic legacy of the Pale Sneaker of Doom brought us this awesome creature of high AC, Epic Dodge, nasty dual wield SA damage output, high stealth capabilities, epic traps expertise, resilience to the powers of magic (spellcraft), a tongue to be held in check (taunt) and last but not least Epic Mage Armor and Epic Warding to augment the defense. Self Concealment has been given up but that is not to be a big concern in environments where Improved Invisibility is easily available, especially if in (rechargeable) wand format which will grant a near endless and easily recastable supply of 50% concealment. Good luck to anyone trying to damage this little fella.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Ok, this build is very very good, but I think I'd change things up a bit, just little tweaks to make it suit my tastes better:

I'd drop Blind Fight and Toughness for KD and IKD. IMO this is a matter of preference. Any sneaker I have EVER built has IKD, even moreso if it's a Halfling (where KD alone isn't enough). I think the lower HP and the diminished ability to pierce concealment are outweighed by the capacity to generate Sneaks and to neutralize casters, but I understand your choices, I guess. I'd also go for EMA before EW, just because with the very high AC you should have, EMA will function in all encounters (16 hours) and make it so that you just won't get hit except on 20s, whereas EW only lasts for 16 rounds, even if it gives you a much better property. Scrolls of Premonition will have to do till then

Anyway, congrats, indeed there are not enough skill points to a guy like this.

I'd also go for EMA before EW, just because with the very high AC you should have, EMA will function in all encounters (16 hours) and make it so that you just won't get hit except on 20s, whereas EW only lasts for 16 rounds, even if it gives you a much better property. Scrolls of Premonition will have to do till then

Anyway, congrats, indeed there are not enough skill points to a guy like this.
A thing to consider i t hat EMA is in general something to free up gear slots rather than to get AC; by the time one gets it, in a balanced mid magic environment (which is the natural reference frame for the game), one already has +5 gear so EMA de facto grants +5 dodge AC.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
A thing to consider i t hat EMA is in general something to free up gear slots rather than to get AC; by the time one gets it, in a balanced mid magic environment (which is the natural reference frame for the game), one already has +5 gear so EMA de facto grants +5 dodge AC.
I know, dude, so with the free slots you can get an amulet to increase your saves (Scarab of Protection) or in WoG a variety of items that will give you pretty much any stat or property you want, plus +5 Dodge AC on a build that has lots of AC from many sources already is great IMO. Besides, Epic Warding is sort of more useful for mobs than players, because mobs fight once every so often (when someone comes to them), while players are always looking for trouble, making its usage somewhat limited in the sense that you'll have multiple encounters between rests so you'll have to choose one to use it in and that's it. And Premonition, which grants 30/+5 DR but lasts an hour per level, can be used by this toon through scrolls.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: EW is for the big boss with high AB that can hit you of course. It can be changed for Mummy Dust on WoG for example, which is a pretty good and long lasting summon. Anyhow, it's a 1 lvl difference and it's in that order just because I typed it in that order, not because I am suggesting to get one before the other

posts.author: RookY2K
posts.content: Question for you Kail. You have really high trap skills but a really low search skill. Is there a specific reason for this? I know this build is skill starved, but it seems kinda weird to have really high disable trap without being able to actually find those traps to disable with the low search. Is 5 (modified) search enough to find the traps you want to disable?

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: You need 23 modified ranks to spot on a 20 a standard epic trap (walk slowly and stop very often where you expect traps). With 5 modified ranks you can spot all traps but epic ones with a more or less lucky roll (depending on the trap, of course) since the highest DC is 22. Getting gear that enhances search is not so unusual, but you may consider also to divert points from Taunt or also Perform, given the weak song. Spellcraft can be dropped to 34 ranks if EW is kept but can be lowered up to 26 ranks if one goes for Mummy Dust/Dragon Knigh/Greater Ruin instead of EW or to 32 ranks if Hellball is taken instead.

posts.author: RookY2K
posts.content:
Correct me if I'm wrong, but you only need 1 rank in disable traps to recover your own epic traps. You have 48 modified ranks in Disable trap, which only makes sense if you want to recover enemy epic traps. However, with 5 modified ranks into search, you will never be able to detect those Epic traps. I know you just replied with alternatives to boost search skill, but it seems like it's not really an alternative but mandatory as built. You either pump up search to 23 modified ranks or you scale back on disable traps skill a few ranks. Unless you are depending on +search equipment to get you the remaining +17 skill?

Sorry, I know this is nitpicking. The build looks very solid, if not spectacular, otherwise. I know I'd want builds I presented to be nitpicked. I'm just trying to understand the seeming contradiction in your skill point allotment.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Aye, Int and search enhancement is necessary to get to 23+ search score. Watchman's Helm is +8 search, Greater Robe of Eyes is +10 search. Int enhancing gear like rings and amulets or even potions also contribute to the final score. That +17 score is not that unreachable and even less so with a bard in the party.

Anyhow, it's true that as is it is kind of not consistent so the skillpoints distribution can be changed to:

Disable Trap 34(48), Hide 39(50), Move Silently 37(50), Open Lock 1(12), Perform 10(9), Search 21(23), Set Trap 31(44), Spellcraft 34(36), Taunt 36(35), Tumble 40(51), UMD 31(30)

Set trap is 1 point below the mark, but one will surely benefit from at least a +2 Dex enhancement by the time one can set epic traps, so no harm done there.

Thank you for pointing out the issue
